definitions.text: the limits within which something can be effective
examples: range of motion
he was beyond the reach of their fire

definitions.text: an area in which something acts or operates or has power or control:
examples: the range of a supersonic jet
a piano has a greater range than the human voice
the ambit of municipal legislation
within the compass of this article
within the scope of an investigation
outside the reach of the law
in the political orbit of a world power

definitions.text: the act of physically reaching or thrusting out

examples: within the compass of education

definitions.text: reach a destination, either real or abstract
examples: We hit Detroit by noon
The water reached the doorstep
We barely made it to the finish line
I have to hit the MAC machine before the weekend starts

definitions.text: reach a point in time, or a certain state or level
examples: The thermometer hit 100 degrees
This car can reach a speed of 140 miles per hour

definitions.text: move forward or upward in order to touch; also in a metaphorical sense
examples: Government reaches out to the people

definitions.text: be in or establish communication with
examples: Our advertisements reach millions
He never contacted his children after he emigrated to Australia
she achieved her goal despite setbacks
The sunlight reached the wall
Can he reach?
The chair must not touch the wall
make the first team
We made it!
She may not make the grade

definitions.text: place into the hands or custody of
examples: hand me the spoon, please
Turn the files over to me, please
He turned over the prisoner to his lawyers

definitions.text: to exert much effort or energy
examples: straining our ears to hear
